--all=false.Description: Select all resources in the namespace of the specified resource types.

--allow-missing-template-keys=true.Description: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

--cascade='background'.Description: Must be 'background', 'orphan', or 'foreground'. Selects the deletion cascading strategy for the dependents (e.g. Pods created by a ReplicationController). Defaults to background.

--dry-run='none'.Description: Must be 'none', 'server', or 'client'. If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

--field-manager='kubectl-client-side-app.Description: Name of the manager used to track field ownership.

-f.Description: that contains the configuration to apply

--filename=[].Description: that contains the configuration to apply

--force=false.Description: If true, immediately remove resources from API and bypass graceful deletion. Note that immediate deletion of some resources may result in inconsistency or data loss and requires confirmation.

--force-conflicts=false.Description: If true, server-side apply will force the changes against conflicts.

--grace-period=-1.Description: Period of time in seconds given to the resource to terminate gracefully. Ignored if negative. Set to 1 for immediate shutdown. Can only be set to 0 when --force is true (force deletion).

-k.Description: Process a kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

--kustomize=''.Description: Process a kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

--openapi-patch=true.Description: If true, use openapi to calculate diff when the openapi presents and the resource can be found in the openapi spec. Otherwise, fall back to use baked-in types.

--overwrite=true.Description: Automatically resolve conflicts between the modified and live configuration by using values from the modified configuration

--prune=false.Description: Automatically delete resource objects, that do not appear in the configs and are created by either apply or create --save-config. Should be used with either -l or --all.

--prune-whitelist=[].Description: Overwrite the default whitelist with <group/version/kind> for --prune

-R.Description: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

--recursive=false.Description: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

-l.Description: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2)

--selector=''.Description: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2)

--server-side=false.Description: If true, apply runs in the server instead of the client.

--show-managed-fields=false.Description: If true, keep the managedFields when printing objects in JSON or YAML format.

--template=''.Description: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

--timeout=0s.Description: The length of time to wait before giving up on a delete, zero means determine a timeout from the size of the object

--validate=false.Description: If true, use a schema to validate the input before sending it

--wait=false.Description: If true, wait for resources to be gone before returning. This waits for finalizers.
